CARDINAL . By virtue of section CARDINAL of LAW ( GPE ) , asylum is granted to aliens who satisfy the conditions of LAW . Applications for asylum are determined in the first instance by the former ORG ( now called ORG ) and in the second instance by ORG .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section DATE , subsection CARDINAL , of LAW , decisions by ORG are final , which means that there is no avenue for appeal against the ORG 's decisions . Aliens may , however , by virtue of LAW ( PERSON ) bring an appeal before the ordinary courts , which have authority to adjudge on any matter concerning the limits to the competence of a public authority .
